page.title: 12MAINTAINING TAUNTON'S CANAL
page.content: In our block,the Bridgwater and Taunton Canal is approximately 12 metres wide and is supposed to be about 1.20 metres deep.However, due to silting it is only half this depth in places. A major problem is the heavy,summer weed growth.While we were there the huge,land based excavator was at work. It works on each stretch of the canal twice a year.It removes the weed and simply deposits it on the far edge of the towpath.The heaps of dried weed looked rather unpleasant and were smothering some wild flowers.All year round a British Waterways Board employee works to keep the vegetation on the banks under control. In a three kilometre stretch of the canal we only spotted a dozen pieces of litter.It was all paper.
